Osejs.Information.Title: Torque-free top
Osejs.Information.Author: Juan M. Aguirregabiria (http://tp.lc.ehu.es/jma.html)
Osejs.Information.Abstract: The simulation displays (in the space frame on the left and in the body frame on the right) the evolution of a torque free ellipsoid around its center of mass. It can be used to check the Tennis Racket Theorem.

Osejs.Description.Page.Name: Introduction
Osejs.Description.Page.Content:
Torque free motion

The simulation displays (in the space frame on the left and in the body frame on the right) the evolution of a torque free ellipsoid around its center of mass. The Lagrangian is as follows:
L = ½ Ix ωx2 +½ Iy ωy2 + ½ Iz ωz2 ,
where the components of the angular velocity in the body frame are
ωx = φ' sin θ sin ψ + θ' cos ψ
ωy = φ' sin θ cos ψ - θ' sin ψ
ωz = φ' cos θ + ψ'
(we use ' for the time derivative).
  • To see the definition of the Euler angles (θ,φ,ψ), click on Variables in the simulation below.
  • There you can also select the initial values, as well as the principal moments of inertia Ix, Iy and Iz.
  • Units are arbitrary.
  • Check Velocities to see the evolution of the angular velocity components in the body frame (ωx,ωy,ωz) and in the space frame (ω'x,ω'y,ω'z), where.
    ω'x = θ' cos φ + ψ' sin φ sin θ
    ω'y = θ' sin φ - ψ' cos φ sin θ
    ω'z = φ' + ψ' cos θ
  • The point of view of the three-dimensional projections can be changed with the cursors or the mouse.
  • Each whole image can be moved with the mouse while pressing Ctrl.
  • To change the zoom in the projections, press Shift when moving up or down the mouse pointer.
  • Put the mouse pointer over an element to get information about it.
Reference: H. Goldstein, Ch. Poole and J. Safko, Classical Mechanics, 3rd edition, Addison-Wesley, San Francisco

Osejs.Description.Page.Name: Activities
Osejs.Description.Page.Content:
Activities

  1. Press Start and get familiarized with the display options below the images.
  2. Let us check the Tennis Racket Theorem:
    • Make sure the body initially spins nearly around its Z axis, i.e., select a fairly higher value for ψ' than for θ' and φ'.
    • Check what happens in the three cases in which
      • Iz < Ix, Iy
      • Iz > Ix, Iy
      • Ix < Iz < Iy or Ix > Iz > Iy
    • Discuss the results.
    • When the initial motion is unstable, is it periodic the evolution in the space/body frame? (It may help enabling Trajectories and/or Velocities.) Comment the result of your numerical experience.

Osejs.Description.Page.Name: Author
Osejs.Description.Page.Content:
This is an English translation of the Basque original for a course on mechanics, oscillations and waves.
It requires Java 1.5 or newer and was created by Juan M. Aguirregabiria with Easy Java Simulations (Ejs) by Francisco Esquembre. I thank Wolfgang Christian and Francisco Esquembre for their help.

Variable.Name: thetad0
Variable.Comment: Initial value for time derivative of Euler angle theta

Variable.Name: phid0
Variable.Comment: Initial value for time derivative of Euler angle phi

Variable.Name: psid0
Variable.Comment: Initial value for time derivative of Euler angle psi

Variable.Name: wx
Variable.Comment: X component of angular velocity in the body frame

Variable.Name: wy
Variable.Comment: Y component of angular velocity in the body frame

Variable.Name: wz
Variable.Comment: Z component of angular velocity in the body frame

Variable.Name: wsx
Variable.Comment: X component of angular velocity in the space frame

Variable.Name: wsy
Variable.Comment: Y component of angular velocity in the space frame

Variable.Name: wsz
Variable.Comment: Z component of angular velocity in the space frame

Variable.Name: Lx
Variable.Comment: X component of angular momentum (body frame)

Variable.Name: Ly
Variable.Comment: Y component of angular momentum (body frame)

Variable.Name: Lz
Variable.Comment: Z component of angular momentum (body frame)

Variable.Name: Lsx
Variable.Comment: X component of angular momentum (space frame)

Variable.Name: Lsy
Variable.Comment: Y component of angular momentum (space frame)

Variable.Name: Lsz
Variable.Comment: Z component of angular momentum (space frame)

Variable.Name: showEuler
Variable.Comment: Show definition of Euler angle variables?

Variable.Name: showVelocities
Variable.Comment: Show precession, nutation and spin velocities

Variable.Name: showTrajectories
Variable.Comment: Show trajectories of angular velocity and momentum

Variable.Name: Nvel
Variable.Comment: Number of points in velocity traces

Content.Comment: Top position, orientation and angular velocity
Compute scale for angular velocity and momentum

Osejs.View.Creation.Element.Property: Derivative of the Euler angle phi
Derivative of the Euler angle theta
Derivative of the Euler angle psi
Select here what has to be shown
Show components of the angular velocity?
Show trajectories of Z axis and angular velocity and momentum?
